result.execSummary:
The defendant Miguel-Angel Oertel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: While incarcerated 25% of the inmate funds shall be applied to outstanding financial obligations.

Counseling deemed necessary.    Take medications as prescribed.    No contact w/victim's family.  Comply with mental health assessments.  Comply with all recommended Department of Corrections programs.

ORIGINAL SENTENCE FROM 8/29/16 IS VACATED.

2:04 p.m. Defendant Miguel-Angel Oertel in court with attorney Roberta Ann Heckes, by phone   Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court gives his oral ruling to the Court.  Court finds that Attorney Hughes performance was deficient and grants a new hearing on the NGI phase.
from the court of appeals that the time to decide the postconviction motion is extended to March 20, 2018

Motion to Court of Appeals to Enlarge Time for Trial Court to Decide Postconviction Motion for a New Trial
cover letter from Attorney Heckes with COA Motion to Enlarge Time
Oral ruling on March 15, 2018 at 02:00 pm.

1:01 p.m. Defendant Miguel-Angel Oertel in court with attorney Roberta Ann Heckes.  Defendant Miguel-Angel Oertel in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Heckes calls Attorney Hughes to the stand.  Michael Hughes is sworn as witness and testifies to the facts regarding when he represented the defendant.  Testifies to his previous experience regarding NGI jury trials.  Testifies to why he didn't have an expert for NGI at trial for the defendant.  Testifies to whom he called for witnesses for the NGI portion.  Testifies to qualifications of the witnesses for the NGI portion. Cross examination by Attorney Lambert.  Testifies to speaking with the defendant and getting his agreement regarding have a expert for the NGI testimony.   Testifies to how many trials he's had.  Testifies to how long he has been practicing law.  Testifies to classification he had for public defender cases he had when appointed.  Re direct Attorney Heckes.  Testifies to his mental health certification for cases.  Re cross from the State.  Re direct from defense.  Re cross from the State.  Court recess 01:30 p.m.    
1:41 p.m.  Court resume  Dr. Gene Bracksma is sworn as witness and testifies to reviewing the records on the case.    Testifies to his medical qualifications.  Testifies to reviewing Dr. Galli's report.  Testifies to believing that further testing would have been beneficial.  Testifies to how a jury may have benefited with a mental health experts testimony.  Cross examination from the State.  2:08, Re direct Attorney Heckes.  Re cross from State.  Attorney Heckes makes an oral argument to sublimit her brief.  Requests a new trial on the NGI portion of the defendants case.  The State makes their argument against the motion.  Court will issue an oral ruling at a later date.

records.addlTxt: 9:34 a.m Defendant Miguel-Angel Oertel in court with attorney Michael Hughes.  Defendant Miguel-Angel Oertel in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Huges makes correction to page 14 on original PSI.  No corrections, additions, or deletions from the State. Victim impact statesments are made by the family of the victim.  Attorney Lambert argues for his recommendation.  Attorney Hughes makes his recommendation.  10:00 a.m.  Miguel makes statement to the Court.  10:30 p.m. Court sentences.

Note from Judge Potter sent to Jury
Phase 2
Phase 1
Jurors Selected for Case
Random Listing Report - Case
3 notes from jury. 1 note from Court to jury.
Phase 2

Defendant Miguel-Angel Oertel in court with attorney Michael Hughes.  Defendant Miguel-Angel Oertel in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  9:05 a.m.  On the record without the jury present.  Court addresses the issue of a juror who may be related to the defendant.  Juror #321 is brought in and the Court questions regarding a possible relation to the juror.  Juror denies any relation with the defendant.  Attorney Lambert questions the juror.  Attorneys Lambert and Hughes agree that there is no conflict and Juror #321 will remain on the panel.  3:10 a.m.  Court and counsel review and discuss instructions.  Attorney Hughes argues for the mistake instruction be admitted. Attorney Lambert opposes. Court orders that the mistake instruction will not be used. Court and counsel review and discuss the verdicts.  9:25 a.m.  Jury is brought in and the Court instructs the jury.  

10:45 a.m.  Attorney Lambert gives his closing argument.  9:58 a.m.  Attorney Hughes gives his closing argument.  10:17 .m.  Attorney Lambert gives rebuttal argument.  10:21 a.m.  Court gives additional instruction to the jury.    10:28 a.m.  Bailiffs are sworn. Alternate juror #321 is excused and the jury leaves the deliberate. 11:31 a.m.  Back on the record without the jury present.  The jurors have sent in a note requesting all the photos be sent back.  Attorneys Lambert and Hughes have no objection.  The photos are sent back.  12:32 p.m. Back on the record.  The jurors have sent a question into the Court.  Judge will respond in writing.  1:04 p.m. Back on the record without the jury present.  Sidebar.  1:08 p.m.  Court places on the record a question from the jurors.  The Court and the parties discuss a response.  Court makes a ruling on a response and the jury is brought in.  Court answers the juror's question.  1:15 p.m.  Jury leaves.  Court admonishes the gallery that they must not use cellphones for pictures or recordings.  

1:52 p.m.  Court reconvenes without the jury present. Court admonishes the crowd regarding reactions to the verdict.  1:53 p.m.   Jury returns with the verdict.  Court finds that the verdict is in proper form.  Count 1 - Guilty.  Court polls the jurors.  1:56 p.m. Court takes an adjournment.  

2:08 p.m.  Court reconvenes without the jury present.   2:12 p.m. Jury returns and the Court commences with the second phase of the trial.  Court instructs the jury.  2:13 p.m.  Attorney Hughes gives his opening statement.  2:18 p.m. Attorney Lambert gives his opening statement.  2:20 p.m.  Dr. Michael Galli is sworn and questioned by Attorney Hughes.  Testifies to employment as a clinical psychologist.  Testifies to education and training.  Testifies to speaking with the defendant for an evaluation.  Exhibit 25 is marked and identified as the doctor's report.  Attorney Hughes questions the witness regarding the report.  Exhibit 26 is marked and identified by the witness as defendant's medical records.  2:32 p.m.  Cross-examination by Attorney Lambert.  Questions witness regarding past employment.  Exhibit 25 is received into evidence.  2:47 p.m.  Re-direct by Attorney Hughes.  2:54 p.m. Re-direct by Attorney Hughes.  

2:27 p.m.  Maria Housworth is sworn and questioned by Attorney Hughes.  Witness identifies the defendant as her son.  Testifies to concerns over her son's mental health.  Testifies to the disorders that defendant has been diagnosed with and identifies them.  Questions witness regarding Exhibit 26.  3:15 p.m.  Cross-examination by Attorney Lambert.  3:17 p.m. Rachel Seevers is sworn and questioned by Attorney Hughes. Testifies to employment as a high school counselor.  Witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom.  Testifies to education and training.  Testifies to her concerns about the defendant.  3:25 p.m.  Cross-examination by Attorney Lambert.  3:25 p.m. Court takes an adjournment.  3:42 p.m.  Court reconvenes with the jury present.  3:43 p.m.  Miguel Oertel is sworn and questioned by Attorney Hughes.  Questions witness regarding his mental health and medication taken.  Witness reviews Exhibit 26.  Questions witness regarding the records in Exhibit 26.  4:10 p.m.  Cross-examination by Attorney Lambert.  4:15 p.m.  Re-direct by Attorney Hughes.  4:17 p.m.  Jury leaves and the Court adjourns.  Attorney Lambert makes a motion for dismissal of the NGI defense.  Attorney Hughes gives his argument opposing the motion.  4:21 p.m.  Court will take a break and come back with a ruling.   4:35 p.m.  Court is back on the record without the jury present.  Court denies the motion to dismiss the NGI.  4:37 p.m.  Jury instructions have been reviewed and are approved.  4:42 p.m.  Court instructs the jury.  

4:45 p.m.  Attorney Hughes gives his closing argument.  4:48 p.m.  Attorney Lambert gives his closing argument.  5:07 p.m.  Attorney Hughes gives additional closing argument.  5:10 p.m.  Jury leaves to deliberate.  

6:15 p.m. Court reconvenes with the jury present.  Jury has reached their verdict.  Court finds the verdict is in proper form.  Court finds that the defendant does have a mental illness and finds that it was not the cause of the crime.  Court polls the jury.  Proceedings are completed.

6:20 p.m.  Attorney Lambert moves for judgment on the verdict.  Court orders a pre-sentence investigation.  Sentencing is scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 11:00 a.m.  Bail is revoked.
27 exhibits
27 exhibits marked and received into evidence.
Phase 1

Defendant Miguel-Angel Oertel in court with attorney Michael Hughes.  Defendant Miguel-Angel Oertel in custody.  Craig Lambert and Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:08 a.m.  Court is open without the jury present.  The parties have reached some stipulations regarding prior convictions of potential witnesses, chain of custody. photographs that will be presented by the State, medical records to be presented from Aspirus Doctor's Clinic, sequestration of witnesses and the playing of the 911 call.  

9:15 a.m.  Jury is brought in and sworn.  23 jurors are called to the jury box.  9:23 a.m.  Court addresses the potential jurors.  Attorney Lambert introduces himself and his potential witnesses.  Attorney Hughes introduces himself, his client and his potential witnesses.  9:28 a.m.  Court commences with voir dire.   9:40 a.m.  Attorney Lambert commences with voir dire.  10:00 a.m. Attorney Hughes commences with voir dire.  Juror #591 is excused.  10:22 a.m.  Counsel commence with strikes and court instructs the jury.  10:31 a.m.  Thirteen jurors are selected, sworn and seated.  Court reads instruction #601 to the jurors.  10:36 a.m.  Attorney Lambert gives his opening statement.  10:43 a.m.  Attorney Hughes gives his opening statement.  10:56 a.m. Jury leaves and the court takes a break.   11:17 a.m. Jury returns and court reconvenes.  11:18 a.m.  Amber Coates is sworn and questioned by Attorney Lambert.  Testifies to her relationship with the defendant and witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom.  Testifies to her contact with the defendant on the day of the incident.  11:35 a.m.  Cross-examination by Attorney Hughes.  Questions witness regarding a statement she made to the police and witness reviews her statement.  Questions witness regarding the timeline of the incident.  11:42 a.m . Re-direct by Attorney Lambert.  11:43 a.m.  Sidebar.  Exhibit 1 is marked and received into evidence.  The 911 call is played for the jury.  11:52 a.m.  Jury leaves.  Court places the sidebar issue on the record.  Court adjourns for lunch.  

1:05 p.m. Court reconvenes with the jury present.  Deputy Jessie Nehls is sworn and questioned by Attorney Lambert. Testifies to being dispatched to the residence of the victim regarding the shooting.  Testifies to his observations.  1:11 p.m.  Sergeant David Drinkwine is sworn and questioned by Attorney Lambert.  Testifies to being dispatched to the residence of the victim regarding the shooting. Testifies to his observations.  1:16 p.m.  Deputy James Pidgeon is sworn and questioned by Attorney Lambert.  Testifies to being dispatched to the residence of the victim regarding the shooting. Testifies to his observations.  Exhibits 2 through 6 are marked and identified by the witness.  Exhibits 2 through 6 are published to the jury and received into evidence.   1:27 p.m.  Charles Evans is sworn and questioned by Attorney Lambert. Testifies to employment as a Deputy Cororner with Wood County.  Witness reviews and identifies Exhibits 7 and 8.  Exhibits 7 and 8 are received into evidence.  Witness reviews Exhibit 9.  Exhibit 9 is received into evidence.  1:32 p.m. Cross-examination by Attorney Hughes.  Questions witness regarding information on the death certificate.  1:34 p.m.  Re-direct by Attorney Lambert.  1:35 p.m.  Re-cross by Attorney Hughes.  1:35 p.m.  Re-direct by Attorney Lambert.  1:35 p.m.  Re-cross by Attorney Hughes.  1:36 p.m.  Dr. Thomas Stier is sworn and questioned by Attorney Lambert. Testifies to employment, education and training.  Testifies to performing autopsies in the State of Wisconsin.  Testifies to the procedure used in performing autopsies.  Witness reviews and identifies Exhibit 10.  Witness testifies to his findings in the autopsy.  Exhibit 10 is received into evidence.  1:47 p.m.  Cross-examination by Attorney Hughes.  Questions witness regarding his report.  1:48 p.m.  Attorney Hughes requests a brief break.  Court grants and jury leaves.  2:01 p.m. Court reconvenes with the jury present.  Robert Sanders is sworn and questioned by Attorney Lambert. Testifies to being a forensic imaging specialist at the State Crime Lab.  Testifies to taking photographs at the crime scene.  Exhibits 11 through 21 are marked and identified by the witness. Exhibits 11 through 21 are published to the jury.  2:15 p.m.  Nick Stahlke is sworn and questioned by Attorney Lambert. Testifies to employment as a Forensic Science Training Coordinator at the State Crime Lab.    Testifies to his duties.  Testifies to his observations at the crime scene.  Witness reviews Exhibits 11 through 21 and describes the debris in the photos.  Exhibits 11 through 21 are received into evidence.  2:33 p.m.  Charles Cates is sworn and questioned by Attorney Lambert.  Testifies to employment at the State Crime Lab as a fingerprints analyst.  Testifies to education and training.  Exhibit 22 is marked and reviewed by the witness.  Testifies to the findings.  Exhibit 22 is received into evidence.  2:38 p.m. Rebecca Ciske is sworn and questioned by Attorney Lambert.  Testifies to employment as a forensic scientist in DNA analyst.  Testifies to training and education. Testifies to the procedure used in identifying DNA.  Exhibit 23 is marked and identified by the witness.  Testifies to her findings.   Exhibit 23 is received into evidence.  2:45 p.m.  Cross-examination by Attorney Hughes.  2:46 p.m.  Attorney Lambert requests an adjournment.  Court grants and the jury leaves.  3:08 p.m.  Court reconvenes with the jury present.  Investigator Sergeant Scott Machotka is sworn and questioned by Attorney Lambert.  Testifies to his role as investigator in this case.  Testifies to his investigation regarding the shotgun.  Testifies to his conversations with the defendant.  Witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom.  Testifies to being a firearms instructor and his duties.  Witness opens the box where the shotgun is stored.  The box is marked as Exhibit 24. Other items are in the box, Exhibit 24 is only the shotgun.  Exhibit 24 is received into evidence.  Witness identifies the type of shotgun and how the shotgun works.  3:28 p.m.  Cross-examination by Attorney Hughes.  Questions witness regarding his reports regarding the incident.  Witness reviews his police reports.  Questions witness at length regarding his interviews with the defendant.  3:45 p.m. Re-direct by Attorney Lambert.  Exhibit 24 will be released back to the WCSD.  3:48 p.m.  State rests.  Jury leaves. Court takes a break.  4:01 p.m.  Court reconvenes without the jury present.  Attorney Hughes states that his client will testify and the Court enters into a colloquy with the defendant.  4:04 p.m.  Jury returns.  Miguel Oertel is sworn and questioned by Attorney Hughes.  Testifies to the specifics of the shooting.  4:25 p.m. Cross-examination by Attorney Lambert.  4:33 p.m.  Re-direct by Attorney Hughes.  Defense rests.

Attorney Hughes files a motion and makes a statement in support of same.  Attorney Lambert does not oppose and makes a statement to the Court.  Court grants the motion.

Cover Letter from Atty. Michael D. Hughes, dated Oct. 19, 2015.
for Bond Hearing held September 16, 2015.  (Denise A. Zamow, Court Reporter)

Defendant Miguel-Angel Oertel in court with attorney Michael Hughes.  Defendant Miguel-Angel Oertel in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Sergeant Scott Machotka is sworn and questioned by Attorney Lambert. Testifies to being dispatched to a residence in the Town of Saratoga regarding a shooting.  Testifies to his observations that two people suffered gunshot wounds at the residence.  Testifies that the parties were transported to St. Joseph's Hospital and the victim in this matter was pronounced dead.  Testifies to the cause of death.  Testifies to speaking with the victim's daughter who was at the residence.  Testifies to speaking to the defendant regarding what happened at the residence. Witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom.  Testifies that the incident took place on August 17, 2015.  Cross-examination by Attorney Hughes.  Questions witness regarding his conversation with the victim's daughter.  Questions witness regarding specifics of the incident at the residence.  

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and that the defendant committed it. Bond is continued.
